name: 1. Waterproofer to inspect substrate to confirm acceptability. Ensure clean, dry, devoid of contamination and excess dust removed and vacuumed.
2. Fillet bond breaker using Aquastop 70 tape and Nanosil to improve adhesion. Ensure all tape is bonded to the substrate.
3. Polyurethane fillet to internal vertical corners in shower, at junction of concrete with puddleflange, clearout, pipework
4. Primer A Eco to be applied to porous substrate (Data Sheet attached) All concrete and wall linings
5. Prime Keragrip Eco for non porous primer (Data sheet attached) Angles, puddlefalnges, threaded pipework

6. 1st Coat Kera Trade WPM (Data Sheet attached) Applied to floor, 150mm high including perimeter banding and 200mm above shower rose and extending 200mm past shower screen location. Extend to vanity 150mm min. surround to side and above vanity shelf. Extend 150mm below level of vanity.
7. 24hr Curing (Typical*) *curing time are typical, refer to manufacturer spec for product curing times
*curing time are typical, refer to manufacturer spec for product curing times
*curing time are typical, refer to manufacturer spec for product curing times
10. Dry Film Thickness (DFT) Test completed min 1.13mm
12. Final Water Test Measure Completed - AS3740-2010
14. Waterproof installer to check / provide go ahead
Inspect for wall quality to accept tiles and ensure that substrate free from debris
Inspect concrete substrate free from debris Cracks >0.2mm to be filled with Polyurethane
Locate termination points and set for Angle location at door entry.
Set angle / termination points under door leaf
Correct RL as per architectural drawings
Waterproofing membrane inspected by Toga and approved to receive screed beds. Check with waterproofer for go ahead
Floorwastes protected to prevent debris entering into drains with compressible sponges
Clearout pipework to finish at screed bed level
Setout and starting point verified with Builder and Drawings
Ensure standard sceed thickness minimum of 15mm.
Screed areas lower than 15mm to minimum 10mm to recieve engineered binder (Keracem ECO in replacement of Grey cement)
Where screed beds lower than 10mm use Keralevel LR with Universal Primer
Ensure substrate free from loose material to maximise bond to acoustic mat / screed bed
Ensure acoustic matting has no gaps / weighted roller
Any gaps to be filled with Polyurethane and finished flush
Quality (Set-out, tile cuts, even joints & flatness)
Verify strip drain size and position of waste outlet
Falls to waste as per drawing / isolate falls to waste
No lipping tiles exceeding A.S tolerances 1.5mm
General sweep clean of terrazzo floors
Wet wipe excess dust off tile surface
Lambs wool application of presealer to terrazzo floor surface prior to grouting - 1 coat
Allow preseal to cure minimum 8 hours before grouting. Area to be baricaded off from entering.
Surface is uniform and clean / no grout build up / internal corners free of grout
Corflute taped down (no black corflute) cover entire tiled surface
Make allowance for toilet pans, partitions / glass installation
